faq.title: Frequently asked questions about renting a house

items.question: Is renting a house more expensive than renting an apartment?
items.answer: Houses usually offer more space and privacy, so monthly rent is often higher than for an apartment.

items.question: Are pets allowed in a rental house?
items.answer: This depends on the rental contract. Many landlords are more open to pets in houses than in apartments.

items.question: Are there minimum rental periods?
items.answer: Many rental agreements have minimum terms of 12 months or longer.

items.question: Can I buy the house later on?
items.answer: Some landlords offer rent-to-own models, but this always depends on the individual property.
